availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

body.p: Born in 1831 in Germany. Merchant. Married to Lizzie Jacobs February 11, 1858 in Louisville. Children included Lena Jacobs Frinck Karwiese, Carl H., Theodore Daniel, and E. Bertrand. Dealer in Kentucky Copper Whiskey. Died on October 14, 1878 in Jefferson County, Kentucky.

bibl.p: Proceedings of the Grand Lodge of Free and Accepted Masons of the State of Kentucky: Seventy-Ninth Grand Annual Communication (Louisville: Masonic Widows and Orphanâ€™s Home, 1878); The Industries of Louisville, Kentucky and of New Albany, Indiana (Louisville: J.M. Elstner & Co. Publishers, 1886); "Find A Grave Index," database, FamilySearch (https://familysearch.org/ark:/61903/1:1:QVG2-M889 : 13 December 2015), C. Henry Finck, 1878; Burial, Louisville, Jefferson, Kentucky, United States of America, Cave Hill Cemetery; citing record ID 127299759, Find a Grave, http://www.findagrave.com.
